title: View or edit company
content:
This page explains how to view or edit a company record.

View or edit company 

  1. Click  > Plan > Company.
  2. Click the name of the company you want to view or edit. The company record contains the following tabs.
    Tab Description
    General View and edit company details, account admins, sites, and attachments. For more information, see the "General tab" section.
    Workflow View the workflow and current phase of the company. For information on the company workflow and the procedure to change the phase, see the Company workflow page.
    Related contracts View and add contracts associated with the company. For more information, see the "Related contracts tab" section.
    Related parties

    View the users of the company. View, add, and remove related companies. View, add, and remove users of the related companies.

    For more information, see the "Related parties tab" section.
    Entitlements View and add entitlements. For information about entitlements, see the "Entitlements tab" section . 
    Purchased products View and add purchased product instances. For information about product instances, see "Purchased products tab" section.
    Licenses View and add licenses consumed by the company. For information about licenses, see the "Licenses tab"  section.
    Environments View and add environments. For information about environments, see the "Environments tab" section.
    Requests View the requests raised by and raised for the company. For information about requests, see the "Requests tab" section.
    Discussions View any relevant conversations about the company. For more information, see the Discussions page.
    History View changes to the company record. For more information, see the History page
  3. Click the tab you want to view or edit.
  4. Edit as required.
  5. Click Save on the toolbar to save your changes.

General tab

The General tab has the following sections:

  • Company details
  • Account admins
  • Contacts
  • Sites
  • Attachments

Company details

Field Description
Name The name of the company.
DUNS number The DUNS number of the company. This information is provided by the company.
Code The identification code of the company.
Company type

The company type. The available options are:

Internal: An internal department or unit within a large company.
Vendor: A company that develops and sells software or hardware products.

Supplier: A company or individual that provides raw materials, components, or products required by manufacturers to create finished goods.

Manufacturer: A company that produces finished goods by using raw materials, components, and labor.

Distributor: A company or individual that acts as a sales partner for manufacturers. Distributors buy products in bulk from manufacturers and resell them to wholesalers or retailers.

Wholesaler: A company or individual that buys large quantities of goods from manufacturers or distributors and resells them in smaller quantities to retailers or other businesses.

Service provider: A company or individual that provides services to other businesses or end users.

Cloud service provider: A type of service provider that offers cloud-based services.

Publisher: A company that publishes software, digital books, or digital content.

Customer: An individual or company that purchases and consumes the product or service.
Partner: A company or individual that collaborates with another company to deliver services and achieve shared goals.
Logo The logo of the company. 
Description The description of the company.
Web site The URL of the company’s official website.
Phone The support contact number of the company.
Email The support email address of the company.
Fax The fax number of the company.
Account team
The team from your organization responsible for managing the business relationship with the customer company and maintaining its information in the application.
This field is relevant only for customer companies.
Support team
The team from your organization responsible for providing technical assistance, troubleshooting, and customer support to the customer company.
This field is relevant only for customer companies.
Primary customer contact
The main point of contact within the customer company responsible for communicating updates to company information, handling escalations, and coordinating with your organization.
This field is relevant only for customer companies.
Security contact
The person from the customer company responsible for security-related communications.
This field is relevant only for customer companies.
Industry The sector in which the company operates. The available options are: Finance, Healthcare, and Technology.
Time zone The time zone in which the company operates. Used for scheduling meetings, determining support availability, and ensuring service delivery aligns with business hours.
Grace period (days) The additional number of days provided beyond the due date before suspensions or terminations take effect.
Domain The official web domain associated with the company.
External reference The unique identifier or reference number used for mapping the company record with external systems.
Allow surveys
Specifies whether the company allows surveys or feedback requests for customer satisfaction or market research.
This field is relevant only for customer companies.
Allow notifications
Specifies whether the company allows notifications, alerts, or updates related to account activity, events, or cases. This field is relevant only for customer companies.

Account admins

This section displays the account admins of the company.

Who is an account admin?

Account admin is responsible for managing and maintaining customer company data in the application. An account admin can be one of the following:

  • A person from your organization who is responsible for communicating with the customer company and ensuring that the customer data, such as company details, contracts, purchased products, and entitlements, is up to date in the application.
  • A contact person from the customer company who is responsible for providing any updates to the customer data.

Add account admin

Prerequisite:

Ensure that the person is added as a user or contact in the application. For the procedure to add users or contacts, see How to create and delete users or contacts. 

To add an account admin:

  1. Click Add. This displays a list of all users and contacts of the application.
  2. Select the person you want to assign as the account admin. You can select multiple people, if required.
  3. Click OK. This adds the selected person to the Account admins section.
  4. Click Save on the toolbar.

Remove account admin

Removing an account admin for a company does not delete the user or contact from the application. It only removes their designation as an account admin.

To remove an account admin:

  1. Click anywhere on the account admin record (except the ID) that you want to remove. The record is highlighted in gray.
  2. Click Remove. A strikethrough appears across the entire record, marking it for removal.
  3. Repeat steps 1 and 2 for all the account admins you want to remove.
  4. Click Save on the toolbar.

Sites

This section displays the sites of the company.

What is a site

A site refers to the geographic location of the company.

Add site

Prerequisite:

Ensure that the location details are added in the agent interface. For the procedure to add location details, see the "Add a location to the list of locations" section in Locations. 

To add a site:

  1. Click Add. This displays the list of locations available in the agent interface.
  2. Select all applicable locations. 
  3. Click OK. This adds the selected locations to the Sites section. 
  4. Click Save on the toolbar.

Remove site

  1. Click the site you want to remove. The site record is highlighted in gray.
  2. Click Remove. A strikethrough appears across the entire record, marking it for removal.
  3. Repeat steps 1 and 2 for all the sites you want to remove.
  4. Click Save on the toolbar.

Designate site as headquarters

  1. Click the site you want to designate as headquarters. The site record is highlighted in gray.
  2. Click Set as Headquarters. The headquarters icon  appears next to the site name.
  3. Click Save on the toolbar.

Remove headquarters designation

  1. Click the site with the headquarters icon  .
  2. Click Remove Headquarters.
  3. Click Save on the toolbar.

Attachments

This section displays the attachments related to the company.

Add attachment

Your suite administrator defines an attachment allowlist in Suite Administration. You can only upload attachments with a file type in this allowlist.  The attachment file name mustn't exceed 200 characters in length.

To add an attachment:

  1. Click Add attachment.
  2. Upload the attachment. This adds the attachment to the Attachments section.
  3. Repeat steps 1 and 2 to add more attachments.
  4. Click Save on the toolbar.

Delete attachment

  1. Click the delete icon  on the attachment you want to delete.
  2. Click OK in the Confirm Attachment Deletion dialog box.
  3. Repeat steps 1 and 2 for all the attachments you want to delete.
  4. Click Save on the toolbar.

Workflow tab

This tab displays the company workflow. The current phase of the company is highlighted in blue in the workflow. 

For information on the company workflow and the procedure to change the company's phase, see the Company workflow page.

Related contracts tab

This tab displays the contracts associated with the company.

Add contract

  1. Click New.
  2. Follow the steps starting from step 3 in the "Create a contract record" section in the Create or update a contract record page.

View or edit details of contract

  • Click the contract number of the contract. See the "Update a contract record" section in the Create or update a contract record page.

Related parties tab

The Related parties tab has the following sections:

  • Related companies
  • Users of this company
  • Users of related companies

Related companies

This section displays the related companies of the current company.

What is a related company?

A company that has a business relationship with another company within CSM is referred to as a related company. 

Add related company

When you add one company as a related company to another (for example, Company B to Company A), the system automatically creates a reverse relationship, meaning Company A also becomes a related company to Company B. 

To add a related company:

  1. Click New. Fill the company relation details. The Company from field is auto-filled with the company for which you are adding a related company.
  2. Select the related company from the Company to list.
  3. Select the phase of the relationship from the Phase list. The available options are:
    • Active: Select this option if the relationship between the two companies is currently active.
    • Inactive:  Select this option if the relationship between the two companies is no longer active or has been suspended.
  4. Select the type of the relationship between the two companies from the Relationship type list. The available options are:
    • Customer: Select this option if there is a buyer-seller relationship between the companies.
    • Parent/Child: Select this option if there is a parent-child relationship between the companies.
    • MSP: Select this option if one company is a Managed Service Provider (MSP) for the other.
    • Partner: Select this option if one company is a partner for the other.
  5. Enter a label for the relationship in the Display label box.
  6. Enter a label for the reverse relationship in the Reverse display label box.
  7. Click Save. This adds the related company to the Related companies section and automatically creates a reverse relationship. You can view the reverse relationship in the Related companies section of the related company.

View or edit relation details of related company

  • Click the ID of the related company that you want to view or edit. This displays the following relation details.
    Field Description Is the field editable?
    Display label The label for the relationship. Yes
    Company from The company for which this related company was added. No
    Company to The related company. No
    Relationship type The type of the relationship between the two companies. It can be Customer, Parent/Child, MSP, or Partner. Yes
    Phase The phase of the relationship. It can be either Active or Inactive. Yes

Remove related company

  1. Click anywhere on the related company record (except the ID) that you want to remove. The record is highlighted in gray.
  2. Click Delete. 
  3. Click OK in the Confirm Delete dialog box.

Users of this company

This section displays the users and contacts of the company. To learn about users and contacts, see Users and contacts.

Users of related companies

If you want to grant users of related companies permission to view or create requests on behalf of the company, you must first add the related company’s user to the Users of related companies section.

Add related company user

  1. Click Add. This displays the users of all related companies.
  2. Select the users you want to add.
  3. Click OK.
  4. Click Save on the toolbar.

Remove related company user

  1. Click anywhere on the user record (except the ID) that you want to remove. The record is highlighted in gray.
  2. Click Remove. A strikethrough appears across the entire record, marking it for removal.
  3. Repeat steps 1 and 2 for all the related users you want to remove.
  4. Click Save on the toolbar.

Entitlements tab

This tab displays the entitlements owned by a company and the entitlements for which the company is added as a delegate.

Add entitlement

  1. Click New.
  2. Specify the following details:

    Field

    Description

    Display label

    The display label for the entitlement.

    Entitlement type

    		 The entitlement type. Currently, this field has only one option: Product. A 'Product' type entitlement grants users the permissions to raise or view requests for a product.

    Contract

    The contract associated with the entitlement.

    Description

    A description of the entitlement.
  3. Click SAVE.

View or edit entitlement details

  • Click the ID of the entitlement. See the View or edit entitlement page.

Purchased products tab

This tab displays the product instances purchased by the company.

Add product instance purchased by company

  1. Click New.
  2. Specify the following details:
    Field Description
    Display label The display label for the product instance.
    Product model The product model of the instance. Only product models in the Active phase appear in the dropdown. For the procedure to change the phase of a product model, see the "Change phase of product model" section in the Product model workflow page.
    Version The version of the instance. Only product versions in the Active phase appear in the dropdown. For the procedure to change the phase of a product version, see the "Change phase of version" section in the Version workflow page.
    Company The company that purchased the instance.
    Environment The environment where the instance is deployed. This field is not available if the product model type is a bundle.
    Contract The contract associated with the product instance. 
    Product name The product name. This field is auto-filled based on the product model.
    Serial number The serial number of the instance. This field is not available if the product model type is a bundle.
    Start date The date when the company started using the instance. This field is not available if the product model type is a bundle.
    End date The date when the company stopped using the instance. This field is not available if the product model type is a bundle.
    Description A description of the instance. 
  3. Click SAVE. You can see the product instance record you created in the Purchased products tab. If the product model type is bundle, along with the bundle instance, a product instance will be created for each bundled product. The display names of these instances are the same as those of the corresponding bundled product. 

View or edit product instance details

  • Click the ID of the product instance. See the View or edit product instance page.

Licenses tab

This tab displays the licenses consumed by the company.

Add license consumed by company

  1. Click New.
  2. Specify the following details:
    Field Description
    License class The classification of the license. It is set to Sold license by default for licenses added from the company management module.
    Display label The display label for the license.
    Publisher The company that is offering the license.
    Owner The person who manages or monitors the software.
    Quantity The number of licenses.
    Unit rights

    The number of authorized rights included in one license.

    For example, an organization might buy 5 licenses (the Quantity) each of which allows 20 authorized users (the Unit Rights).

    Total entitlements

    		 Total number of rights to install or use the licensed software according to the license.
    Perpetual

    Select if the license is perpetual. If you select this option, the Start Date and End Date fields no longer apply.
    Start date

    Start date for entitlement to use the software. 

    Note: Available when the license is a subscription.
    End date

    End date for entitlement to use the software. 

    Note: Available when the license is a subscription.
    License contract The contract under which the license is provided.
  3. Click SAVE. You can see the license record you created in the Licenses tab.

View or edit license details

  • Click the ID of the license. See the View or edit license page.

Environments tab

This tab displays the environments owned by the company.

Add environment owned by the company

  1. Click New.
  2. Specify the following details:
    Field Description
    Display label The display label for the environment.
    Service Ignore this field, it is not functional in the current release.
    Environment type The type of environment. The available options are Development, Non production, Production, Staging, Test, Trial.
    Deployment type The deployment model of the product instances deployed in the environment. The available options are On premise, Public cloud, Private cloud.
  3. Click SAVE. You can see the environment record you created in the Environments tab.

View or edit environment details

  • Click the ID of the environment. See the View or edit environment page.

Requests tab

This tab displays the requests raised by users of the company or its delegate companies. Users can submit requests from the service portal, or agents can submit requests on behalf of users from the agent interface.

Raise request from agent interface

  1. Click New.

  2. Complete the Details section.

    Field Description
    Title Type the title of the request.
    Description

    Enter a description for the request. Service Management may automatically recognize CIs whose details are entered here. See CI Detection - Automatic recognition of CIs.
    Requested by

    Select the name of the user who contacted the service desk about opening the request.

    Select a name from the drop-down list or type a few characters to search for the name.
    Requested for

    Select the name of the user for whom you are opening the request.

    Select a name from the drop-down list or type a few characters to search for the name.
    Requested by company

    It is auto-filled with the company to which the user specified in Requested by belongs.


    The field's visibility depends on the type of offering selected and the offering’s configuration, as explained in the following scenarios.


    If no offering is selected, the field is visible and optional.


    If a Case, Support, or Service offering is selected, the field is visible. Whether it is mandatory or optional depends on how the Require company information option is configured in the offering. If the Require company information checkbox is selected in the offering, the field is mandatory. If the checkbox is not selected, the field is optional.


    If an HR Support offering is selected, the field does not appear.
    Requested for company

    Select the company for which the user specified in Requested by wants to raise a request.


    The field's visibility depends on the type of offering selected and the offering’s configuration, as explained in the following scenarios. 


    If no offering is selected, the field is visible and optional.


    If a Case, Support, or Service offering is selected, the field is visible. Whether it is mandatory or optional depends on how the Require company information option is configured in the offering. If the Require company information checkbox is selected in the offering, the field is mandatory. If the checkbox is not selected, the field is optional.

    If an HR Support offering is selected, the field does not appear.
    Impact Select the scope of impact for the request.
    Urgency Select how severely the problem for which you are requesting assistance impacts your job.
    Preferred contact method Select a value from the drop-down.

  3. Complete the Catalog Offering section.

    Field Description
    Offering

    Select an offering.

    At the top of the list of offerings Service Management displays smart suggestions for suitable offerings, based on the text entered in the Title and the Description fields.

    For information about offerings, see Service Catalog Management.

    • If an offering isn't selected, the request is created as a Support Request. If you later select a Service type offering, the request type changes to Service Request. If you later select an HR Support type offering, the request type changes to HR Support Request. If you later select an Case type offering, the request type changes to Case Request.

    • If user options have been defined for the selected offering, they appear in this section.
    Service

    Displays a list of all business and infrastructure services. You can filter the entire list or individual columns to narrow the list of records. At the top of the list, Service Management displays smart suggestions, based on the text entered in the Title and the Description fields.

    If you point to the selected service, a popup window is displayed, including brief details and a link to the record.
    Device

    Select a device for the request.

    Select a value from the drop-down list or type a few characters to search for the name.
    Infrastructure and peripheral

    Select an infrastructure and peripheral asset for the request.

    Select a value from the drop-down list or type a few characters to search for the name.
    Enterprise Asset

    Select an enterprise asset for the request.

    Select a value from the drop-down list or type a few characters to search for the name.
    Subscription

    Select a subscription for the request.

    Select a value from the drop-down list or type a few characters to search for the name.
    Product instance

    Select the product instance for which the user wants to raise a request. The dropdown lists the product instances that the user specified in Requested by and the company specified in Requested for company are entitled to raise requests for. 


    The field's visibility depends on whether CSM is enabled, the type of offering selected, and the offering’s configuration, as explained in the following scenarios.


    If CSM is not enabled on the tenant, the field does not appear.


    If CSM is enabled and no offering is selected, the field is visible and optional.


    If CSM is enabled and an HR Support offering is selected, the field does not appear.


    If CSM is enabled and a Case, Support, or Service offering is selected, the field’s behavior depends on how the Required entitlement information option is configured in the offering. If Required entitlement information in the offering is set to Product or Product and Entitlement, the field is visible and mandatory. If Required entitlement information is unset, the field is not applicable and hidden.
    Entitlement

    Select the entitlement. The dropdown lists the entitlements for which the user specified in Requested by and the company specified in Requested for company can raise requests. 


    The field's visibility depends on whether CSM is enabled, the type of offering selected, and the offering’s configuration, as explained in the following scenarios.


    If CSM is not enabled on the tenant, the field does not appear.


    If CSM is enabled and no offering is selected, the field is visible and optional.


    If CSM is enabled and an HR Support offering is selected, the field does not appear.


    If CSM is enabled and a Case, Support, or Service offering is selected, the field’s behavior depends on how the Required entitlement information option is configured in the offering. If Required entitlement information in the offering is set to Product and Entitlement, the field is visible and mandatory. If Required entitlement information is set to Product, the field is visible and optional. If Required entitlement information is unset, the field is not applicable and hidden.
    Product version

    It is automatically set to the version of the selected product instance, if version information is available. You can also manually select the applicable version from the dropdown if needed.


    The field's visibility depends on whether CSM is enabled, the type of offering selected, and the offering’s configuration, as explained in the following scenarios.


    If CSM is not enabled on the tenant, the field does not appear.


    If CSM is enabled and no offering is selected, the field is visible and optional.


    If CSM is enabled and an HR Support offering is selected, the field does not appear.


    If CSM is enabled and a Case, Support, or Service offering is selected, the field’s behavior depends on how the Required entitlement information option is configured in the offering. If Required entitlement information in the offering is set to Product or Product and Entitlement, the field is visible and optional. If Required entitlement information is unset, the field is not applicable and hidden.
    Product environment

    It is automatically set to the environment of the selected product instance, if environment information is available. 


    The field's visibility depends on whether CSM is enabled, the type of offering selected, and the offering’s configuration, as explained in the following scenarios.


    If CSM is not enabled on the tenant, the field does not appear.


    If CSM is enabled and no offering is selected, the field is visible and optional.


    If CSM is enabled and an HR Support offering is selected, the field does not appear.


    If CSM is enabled and a Case, Support, or Service offering is selected, the field’s behavior depends on how the Required entitlement information option is configured in the offering. If Required entitlement information in the offering is set to Product or Product and Entitlement, the field is visible and optional. If Required entitlement information is unset, the field is not applicable and hidden.

  4. Click SAVE.

    If the offering you selected is an offering bundle, when the request enters the Fulfill phase, the offering bundle's task plan automatically triggers the creation a child request per each bundled offering. The child requests are added to the list of service requests in the Service Request Management module, and can also be viewed in the parent request's Related records tab.

    For more information, see How to edit a request record.

View or edit request details

  • Click the ID of the request. See the Edit a request record page.
